results.title: Why did we fight?: the experience of a Vietnamese Veteran
results.brief_description: Hung and his family were originally from North Vietnam but after fleeing as a child to the South, he would follow in this father’s footsteps and join the army to fight for freedom. After being captured and spending years in re-education camps, his family finally decided to flee to Australia to start a new life.

results.title: Walk - Walk - Walk
results.brief_description: In 1966 Paul was playing in a band, ‘The Castaways’, the next minute he was conscripted to service in Vietnam. When Paul arrived in Vietnam he was told, “You’re in the infantry now, you will walk, and walk, and walk some more. You had to keep on moving, that was how you got through.”

results.title: A Rookie airman's story
results.brief_description: Cliff’s father was a fisherman, so he knew about boats. After joining the airforce in 1942 he would spend the majority of his service running missions on boats. Lucky he didn’t tell them he couldn’t swim.

results.title: Remembering 1945
results.brief_description: Jude remembers her childhood and realises so much of her young life involved war and trauma. Visiting her father in the repatriation hospital she saw first-hand the effects of WWII on those that returned. Most of the men in her family went to WWII and she recalls how the family never recovered from the loss of one cousin at the hands of the Japanese as a POW.

results.title: On borrowed time
results.brief_description: Keith was a member of a Catalina crew in the airforce and the loss of their captain on a mission affected the whole crew. After almost drowning in the plane as she went down in the ocean crash, Keith was not able to fly again.
results.description: Keith was a member of a Catalina crew in the airforce and the loss of their captain on a mission affected the whole crew. After almost drowning in the plane as she went down in the ocean crash, Keith was not able to fly again.

results.title: A Naive country kid
results.brief_description:
At 17 Greg joined the air force and his role would be to give the aircraft the best chance of surviving a crash. Two years after joining up, Greg was sent to Thailand and one particular aircraft rescue would change his outlook on life forever.
Called out to an aircraft crash to help the Americans contain a huge fire, the Aussies were unaware where the aircraft had come from. After the flames were put out, Greg would realise this was a Thai plane that he had flown on many times. The memory of this day would stay with him all his life.

results.title: In my blood
results.creator_credit: Jack Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Serving in Libya , Jack was captured and became a POW. Almost dying from injures , he would spend over 3 months in prisoner camps in Europe. Today he still remember his mates who didn’t make it and the doctor who who saved his life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Effects of war never change
results.creator_credit: Jeff Freeman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jeff only served 2 years in the army in South Vietnam. It was extremely hard to return to normal life and keep an office job after one year in the jungle. The reaction to Vietnam veterans in Australia only made it harder for him to adjust back into a normal life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Freeman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: An Airman at sea
results.brief_description: As Keith flew from Townsville to Milne Bay in Papua New Guinea, he wondered if he would ever see the shores of Australia again. Suffering from dengue fever, Keith battled illness the whole time. He made it back when the war ended and would go on to serve in the RAFF for 20 years.
results.description: As Keith flew from Townsville to Milne Bay in Papua New Guinea, he wondered if he would ever see the shores of Australia again. Suffering from dengue fever, Keith battled illness the whole time. He made it back when the war ended and would go on to serve in the RAFF for 20 years.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.brief_description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.

results.description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
